intro: Phacelia hastata var. hastata, commonly known as blue phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
